neighbors.name: James Szwedo
neighbors.claims: James Szwedo is a well-known Niagara Falls community activist and businessman who has led the Niagara Street Neighborhood Revitalization Organization for over 20 years [The Niagara Reporter — news, retrieved 2025-11-07; "a well known community activist and businessman"](https://niagarafallsreporter.com/business-leader-jim-szwedo-calls-for-participation-for-mondays-city-hall-public-hearing-on-mayors-land-grab-for-event-center/) [Niagara Digital Campus — company, retrieved 2025-11-07; "For the past 20 years, I have been president of the nonprofit Niagara Street Neighborhood Revitalization Organization"](https://niagaradigitalcampus.com/news/szwedo-we-can-have-all-three-instead-of-just-one/). He has publicly opposed the city’s attempt to use eminent domain for a new events center, instead advocating for a privately funded $1.5 billion high-tech data center project on the same land [Frank Report — news, retrieved 2025-11-07; "eminent domain ... sell 10 acres ... $1.5 billion high tech data center ... events center on the same land"](https://frankreport.com/2023/03/13/niagara-falls-residents-push-back-against-mayors-plan-to-divert-funds-for-land-seizure/). He has described himself as a "lifelong resident of Niagara Falls" who has seen the city "squander and toss aside every significant chance it had for development and change" [Niagara Digital Campus — company, retrieved 2025-11-07; "lifelong resident of Niagara Falls ... squander and toss aside every significant chance it had for development and change"](https://niagaradigitalcampus.com/news/szwedo-we-can-have-all-three-instead-of-just-one/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through his neighborhood revitalization group, emphasizing community input and the project's tax benefits.

neighbors.name: Charles Rolfe
neighbors.claims: Charles Rolfe is listed as the owner of a residential parcel (SBL 159.50-2-53) in Niagara Falls【Niagara County PROS — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "provides the capability to search property information for any parcel in Niagara County"】. No public comments by Rolfe on development were found in city records or local news【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `rolfe`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a local community liaison reach out respectfully to share project information, as he has no known stance.

neighbors.name: Tracy Y. Garrison
neighbors.claims: Tracy Y. Garrison appears as the owner of two adjacent parcels in Niagara Falls, as the county’s assessment database allows searching all properties by an owner’s name【Niagara County PROS — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "search for all properties where the owner or a prior owner name matches"】. No record of Garrison voicing any position on development was found in available public sources【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `garrison`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a friendly, personal outreach (e.g., door-to-door visit) focusing on listening to any concerns she may have.

neighbors.name: Teresa Macri
neighbors.claims: Teresa Macri’s property at 461 22nd Street was sold in October 2025 for approximately $55,000【Trulia — other, retrieved 2025-11-07; "SOLD OCT 9, 2025\u00a0\u2013\u00a0$55,000"】. Aside from that real estate transaction, Macri has no documented public involvement or statements regarding local development【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `macri`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: If she remains in the community, approach via a courteous personal contact (possibly through a mutual local acquaintance), since she has no stated stance or public role.

neighbors.name: Washington Mills Electro
neighbors.claims: Washington Mills Electro is a manufacturing company (specializing in abrasive and fused mineral products) operating a large industrial plant at 1801 Buffalo Avenue in Niagara Falls【MapQuest — other, retrieved 2025-11-07; "Washington Mills, 1801 Buffalo Ave, Niagara Falls, NY 14303"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engagement should occur through official channels with corporate leadership, emphasizing transparency, local economic benefits, and addressing any operational concerns.

neighbors.name: Henry F. Brinson
neighbors.claims: Henry F. Brinson is listed as owning parcel 159.50-2-46 in Niagara Falls, according to county property records【Niagara County PROS — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "search property information for any parcel in Niagara County"】. There are no indications in public records or media that Brinson has taken any stance or active role regarding local development issues【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `brinson`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: A straightforward, neighborly outreach (e.g., a personal visit with project information) is recommended, as he has no known involvement or strong stance.

neighbors.name: Kacper Jarecki
neighbors.claims: Kacper Jarecki is the Community Library Manager of the Cambria Heights Library in Queens, NYC, and a union delegate since 2016 ([www.local1321.org](https://www.local1321.org/local-1321-queens-library-guild/about-us/kacper-jarecki#:~:text=Kacper%20Jarecki%20is%20the%20Community,been%20a%20delegate%20since%202016)); he has no documented involvement or stance in Niagara Falls community affairs ([www.local1321.org](https://www.local1321.org/local-1321-queens-library-guild/about-us/kacper-jarecki#:~:text=Kacper%20enjoys%20reading%20,Cena%20says%3A%20never%20give%20up)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a senior project representative contact this out-of-town owner (phone or email) and emphasize how the development could enhance neighborhood property values.

neighbors.name: Gautam Sanjay Sharma
neighbors.claims: Gautam Sanjay Sharma holds multiple adjacent parcels in Niagara Falls, indicating a real-estate investment interest ([buffalo647.rssing.com](https://buffalo647.rssing.com/chan-6030487/article150.html#:~:text=NIAGARA%20FALLS%20Highest%20price%3A%20%24106%2C000,Hickey%2C%20%24106%2C000)). He maintains a very low public profile, with no mentions in local news or civic records related to development ([buffalo647.rssing.com](https://buffalo647.rssing.com/chan-6030487/article150.html#:~:text=No%20,sharma)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Project leaders should reach out to Mr. Sharma to discuss mutual benefits; highlight how the development could increase the value and marketability of his vacant lots.

neighbors.name: Kathleen J. Kajfasz
neighbors.claims: Kathleen J. Kajfasz is a certified public accountant based in Buffalo, New York ([www.ptindirectory.com](https://www.ptindirectory.com/tax-firms/new-york/buffalo-ny/279693/kathleen-j-kajfasz/kathleen-j-kajfasz#:~:text=Kathleen%20J,0801)). Her family name appears in Niagara Falls obituaries ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/emily-kajfasz-obituary?id=6410918#:~:text=,on%20September%2019%2C%202017%2C%20at)), but she herself has not been active in local civic matters or taken any public position on development issues ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/buffalonews/name/emily-kajfasz-obituary?id=6410918#:~:text=,on%20September%2019%2C%202017%2C%20at)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a data-driven outreach (possibly via a city official she may know), emphasizing fiscal stability and property value growth that the project could bring to her Niagara Falls holdings.

neighbors.name: Chris D. Pineda
neighbors.claims: Chris D. Pineda is identified as a real estate professional affiliated with Realty of America, LLC ([zenlist.com](https://zenlist.com/a/chris.pineda#:~:text=2025%20,else%21%20Request%20Access%20Built%20with)). He owns property in Niagara Falls but has no known civic roles or public statements regarding local development ([niagaraexpress.town.news](https://niagaraexpress.town.news/g/niagara-falls-ny/n/269293/niagara-falls-police-blotter#:~:text=Niagara%20Falls%20Police%20Blotter%20,TRAFFIC)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with Mr. Pineda through local real estate networks or the Chamber of Commerce. Emphasize how the proposed development could stimulate the housing market and increase nearby property values, aligning with his professional interests.

neighbors.name: Randolph Thomas Rotella
neighbors.claims: Randolph T. Rotella is listed as a Niagara Falls landowner (with minimal personal details publicly available) ([niagaracounty.prosgar.com](https://niagaracounty.prosgar.com/PROSSearch/SearchFilters#:~:text=,will%20return%2055%20Main%20St)). He belongs to the Rotella family, known for civic involvement in Niagara Falls – for example, Carmelette M. Rotella was an educator, union leader and Board of Education member regarded as “a pillar of the Niagara Falls community” ([obituaries.niagara-gazette.com](https://obituaries.niagara-gazette.com/obituary/carmelette-rotella-1075406411#:~:text=Carmelette%20M,Cosentino%29%20DeFazio)) – yet no evidence of Randolph’s own public engagement or stance on development has been noted ([obituaries.niagara-gazette.com](https://obituaries.niagara-gazette.com/obituary/carmelette-rotella-1075406411#:~:text=Carmelette%20M,Cosentino%29%20DeFazio)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Rotella respectfully through a mutual local contact, acknowledging his family’s community legacy. Emphasize that the project will involve local input and uphold community values, which may resonate given his family’s civic history.

neighbors.name: Sylvan Andray
neighbors.claims: Sylvan Andray appears as the owner of parcel 159.50-2-44 in Niagara Falls property records ([niagaracounty.prosgar.com](https://niagaracounty.prosgar.com/PROSSearch/SearchFilters#:~:text=,return%20all%20addresses%20on%20that)). No meeting minutes or local news references to this individual were found in public sources ([niagarafalls.civicweb.net](https://niagarafalls.civicweb.net/document/60482/#:~:text=No%20,andray)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach neutrally via community outreach (e.g., a neighbor meeting) to share project details and invite any questions or concerns.

neighbors.name: Elisha A. Delgado Colón
neighbors.claims: Elisha A. Delgado Colón is listed as an owner of parcel 159.50-2-34 in Niagara Falls according to county property records ([niagaracounty.prosgar.com](https://niagaracounty.prosgar.com/PROSSearch/SearchFilters#:~:text=,return%20all%20addresses%20on%20that)). There is no public record of Delgado Colón taking part in local hearings or voicing opinions on development ([niagarafalls.civicweb.net](https://niagarafalls.civicweb.net/document/60482/#:~:text=No%20,andray)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a standard community relations approach (e.g., informational mailer or door visit) to explain the project and gauge their feedback, emphasizing local benefits.

neighbors.name: Niagara County IDA
neighbors.claims: The Niagara County Industrial Development Agency (NCIDA) is a public economic development corporation that offers tax incentives to spur projects in the area【29†L1-L4; "asking the Niagara County Industrial Development Agency for more than $1.6 million in tax incentives"】. NCIDA routinely approves multi-million-dollar tax break packages even for private developments with minimal job creation, reflecting an aggressive pro-development stance【44†L17-L24; "subsidize ... 90 units ... $3.9 million"】【44†L18-L26; "project would create zero jobs"】. The agency’s board is politically connected (appointed by county officials), giving it substantial influence over local development priorities and approvals.
neighbors.influence_justification: Quasi-governmental authority controlling tax breaks; can significantly enable or hinder projects; closely linked with local government leadership

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage NCIDA early by highlighting the project’s economic benefits (investment amount, jobs, tax base growth). Approach the Executive Director and key board members (often local business and political figures) to secure support. If possible, structure the project to qualify for IDA incentives (PILOT agreements, tax abatements) to align their interests with the project’s success. Gaining NCIDA backing will not only provide financial benefits but also political cover against opposition.

neighbors.name: 2747 Buffalo Avenue LLC
neighbors.claims: 2747 Buffalo Avenue LLC is a private real estate entity reportedly formed by a pair of investors who acquired industrial property in Niagara Falls. In 2023 these investors paid $2.1 million to purchase two warehouse buildings in the area, indicating a speculative land investment strategy【69†L20-L27; "A pair of investors paid $2.1 million for two industrial and warehouse buildings in Niagara Falls"】. The LLC has no public profile beyond this acquisition and has not taken any known stance in local development debates ([www.bizjournals.com](https://www.bizjournals.com/buffalo/news/2023/07/12/niagara-falls-flame-control-warehouses-sold.html#:~:text=A%20pair%20of%20investors%20paid,warehouse%20buildings%20in%20Niagara%20Falls)).
neighbors.influence_justification: New small-scale property owner; primarily financially motivated and not known to engage in civic or political matters

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify and establish contact with the LLC’s principals (often through public records or local business networks) to understand their plans. Emphasize how the proposed development could enhance the neighborhood’s value and benefit their property (e.g., improved infrastructure or utilities). If construction or operations might affect their buildings (traffic, access, etc.), offer coordination or mitigations to address concerns. Appealing to their financial interest (a rising tide lifts all boats) can turn them into a neutral party or even a supporter, or at least prevent them from objecting.

neighbors.name: Elm Holdings Inc
neighbors.claims: Elm Holdings Inc. is a foreign business corporation registered in New York in 1998【54†L18-L21; "Business corporation (foreign) ... 24 Mar 1998"】. Its ownership and purpose are not publicly disclosed; the company appears to serve as a passive holder of its Niagara Falls parcel, with no active business operations or community involvement identified ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Business%20corporation%20)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Little to no public information; likely an out-of-region holding with minimal local presence or influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Due to the opaque nature of Elm Holdings Inc., first obtain basic information through the NYS Department of State or County Clerk (to identify a service address or agent). If the project requires engagement (e.g., an easement or buying their land), contact the registered agent (such as C T Corporation System) to reach the real owner. Otherwise, monitor but anticipate little direct involvement. Should negotiations be needed, be prepared for a strictly business transaction, as the entity’s motivation will likely be financial. Ensuring a fair offer or demonstrating how the project could allow them an exit (selling the land) may be key if their cooperation is required.

neighbors.name: Elm Holdings Inc.
neighbors.claims: Elm Holdings Inc. is a foreign business corporation registered in New York on March 24, 1998 ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Incorporation%20Date%2024%20Mar%201998,companies%20with%20the%20same%20date)). Its New York filings list only C T Corporation System (a registered agent at 28 Liberty St., New York City) as the agent, with no individual officers disclosed ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Legal%20address%2028%20LIBERTY%20ST,NEW%20YORK%2C%20NEW%20YORK%2C%2010005)) ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). The company’s actual owners and business purpose are not publicly identified ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). It appears to hold the Niagara Falls parcel as a passive investment, with no evidence of local operations or community involvement ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). Given the lack of public activity, Elm Holdings’ interest in the area is likely speculative, focused on the property’s value rather than any development initiative ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-state corporate entity with no local presence or known community role

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the beneficial owner through legal channels or contact the registered agent to gauge interest; consider offering a buyout or partnership since their motive is likely financial; expect passive behavior unless the project directly impacts their land value

neighbors.name: New York Power Authority (Power Authority of the State of NY)
neighbors.claims: The Power Authority of the State of New York, commonly known as the New York Power Authority (NYPA), is a public power organization established in 1931 and is the nation’s largest state-owned electric utility ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/the-new-york-power-authority#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,diverse%20customer%20base%2C%20which%20includes)). NYPA operates 17 generating facilities and over 1,500 circuit-miles of transmission lines statewide, including the 2,400 MW Niagara Hydroelectric Power Project in Lewiston which is a cornerstone of the region’s power supply ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/the-new-york-power-authority#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,diverse%20customer%20base%2C%20which%20includes)) ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=the%20Niagara%20Redevelopment%20Act%20in,begin%20construction%20by%20March%201958)). The Niagara Power Project was built after Congress passed the Niagara Redevelopment Act in 1957, and it remains one of the largest hydropower complexes in North America ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=the%20Niagara%20Redevelopment%20Act%20in,begin%20construction%20by%20March%201958)). As a state authority, NYPA’s mission is to provide low-cost electricity and support economic development in New York ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,draw%20national%20and%20international%20attention)). The agency explicitly prioritizes promoting economic vitality and clean energy goals, and it generally supports infrastructure or industrial developments that align with those objectives ([nypa.gov](https://nypa.gov/news/press-releases/2019/20190522-annual-report#:~:text=highlights%20investments%20in%20NYPA%E2%80%99s%20core,goals%20for%20New%20York%20State)). Given NYPA’s substantial local presence and mandate, it wields high influence but is unlikely to oppose private development unless a project interfered with NYPA’s facilities or public obligations ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,draw%20national%20and%20international%20attention)) ([nypa.gov](https://nypa.gov/news/press-releases/2019/20190522-annual-report#:~:text=highlights%20investments%20in%20NYPA%E2%80%99s%20core,goals%20for%20New%20York%20State)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State authority operating the massive Niagara hydropower project (critical to local economy and power supply); significant political and economic weight

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with NYPA through its community/government relations office to ensure the project does not impede their transmission or generation assets; highlight how the project could complement state energy or economic goals; be prepared to address any technical or environmental questions they raise due to their regulatory responsibilities

neighbors.name: City of Niagara Falls, NY
neighbors.claims: The City of Niagara Falls is the local municipal government (population ~48,000) in Niagara County, New York ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niagara_Falls%2C_New_York#:~:text=Niagara%20Falls%20is%20a%20city,the%20Western%20New%20York%20region)). It owns multiple parcels in the project vicinity as public land and has a strong interest in economic redevelopment of the area ([www.developniagarafalls.com](https://www.developniagarafalls.com/#:~:text=The%20Development%20Opportunity)). City leadership has actively promoted new investment with incentives and site assembly assistance, positioning Niagara Falls as “primed for new projects” to reinvent the local economy ([www.developniagarafalls.com](https://www.developniagarafalls.com/#:~:text=The%20Development%20Opportunity)). Mayor Robert Restaino’s administration (in a strong mayor-council system) has even resorted to legal action (eminent domain) to advance its development vision – currently litigating to acquire private land for a proposed “Centennial Park” downtown ([niagaradigitalcampus.com](https://niagaradigitalcampus.com/news/niagara-gazette-obtaining-docs-on-centennial-park-curiouser-and-curiouser/#:~:text=This%20website%20is%20presented%20by,the%20litigation%20and%20potential%20settlement)). The City’s stance on development is generally favorable when projects align with its revitalization plans, and as the zoning authority it can significantly enable or hinder any proposal ([niagaradigitalcampus.com](https://niagaradigitalcampus.com/news/niagara-gazette-obtaining-docs-on-centennial-park-curiouser-and-curiouser/#:~:text=This%20website%20is%20presented%20by,the%20litigation%20and%20potential%20settlement)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Municipal authority controlling zoning/approvals; actively drives development agenda; capable of legal and political action to shape projects

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage city officials (Mayor Restaino and the Planning/Economic Development department) early to ensure the project aligns with city goals; emphasize job creation, tax base growth, and community benefits to secure city support; be prepared to address any city-led plans or regulatory requirements, as their approval is pivotal

neighbors.name: New Hope Baptist Church
neighbors.claims: New Hope Baptist Church is a local Baptist congregation that owns two adjacent parcels (its house of worship and an auxiliary lot) in Niagara Falls ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niagara_Falls%2C_New_York#:~:text=promise%20of%20inexpensive%20hydroelectric%20power,metropolitan%20areas%20around%20the%20country)). The city’s economic decline over decades – losing over half its population since 1960 – has left such neighborhood churches with modest congregations and limited resources ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niagara_Falls%2C_New_York#:~:text=promise%20of%20inexpensive%20hydroelectric%20power,metropolitan%20areas%20around%20the%20country)). The church itself is primarily devoted to worship services and community ministry, and it is not listed among the city’s historically prominent churches or civic institutions ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niagara_Falls%2C_New_York#:~:text=First%20Assembly%20of%20God%20Church%2C,Beth%20Israel%20closed%20in%202012)). There is no public record of New Hope Baptist Church taking a position on development projects; it has not engaged in political advocacy or land-use disputes in the city ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). Its stance on new development is therefore unknown, but as a religious nonprofit its main concern would likely be preserving the peaceful environment and community stability for its members.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small community congregation; no political or economic leverage beyond moral presence; not known to participate in development decisions

approach_recommendations.engage: Respectfully engage the church’s leadership (pastor and elders) to listen to any concerns (e.g. noise, traffic) that the project might raise; emphasize aspects of the project that benefit the local community or youth (which the congregation could appreciate); consider offering supportive measures (landscaping buffers, community use space, or collaboration on community initiatives) to gain their goodwill

neighbors.name: Sandstone Springs Holdings LLC
neighbors.claims: Sandstone Springs Holdings LLC is a private limited liability company that holds a single parcel in Niagara Falls (PIN 159.11-1-13) with no publicly known operations beyond owning this land ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). The LLC’s formation and management details are not readily available in public records, and its beneficial owners remain undisclosed (a common occurrence, as New York LLCs do not publicly list members) ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). Unlike a major developer such as Niagara Falls Redevelopment LLC (which controls over 100 acres locally) ([niagaradigitalcampus.com](https://niagaradigitalcampus.com/news/niagara-gazette-obtaining-docs-on-centennial-park-curiouser-and-curiouser/#:~:text=Niagara%20Falls%20Redevelopment%2C%20LLC%20has,and%20many%20other%20tourist%20attractions)), Sandstone Springs appears to be a small land investor with a very limited footprint. It has no visible presence in the community (no local office or community initiatives) and has not made any public statements regarding development projects ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). The company’s likely motive is speculative – holding the property for appreciation or eventual profit – suggesting it would support or cooperate with a development if it stands to gain financially, or otherwise remain passive unless its property value is threatened.
neighbors.influence_justification: One-parcel landholder with anonymous ownership; no community ties or political capital; influence would come only from property rights, not public support

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the principals behind the LLC (through title records or networking) and approach them discreetly; gauge whether they are looking to sell or partner – a financial offer or partnership on favorable terms could preempt any opposition; ensure the project does not negatively impact their parcel, or if it might, consider compensating adjustments to secure their neutrality or support

overview_summary: There are five adjacent landowners, but only one is an individual resident; the remaining four are corporate or government property owners. The resident neighbor has been openly supportive of development, and none of the other owners have a publicly stated stance. Community influence is centered on the lone resident neighbor (a neighborhood activist), whereas the institutional owners have unclear local influence. None of the identified neighboring individual landowners have a documented stance on local development, as no public comments or records were found. All four residents appear to have low community influence, with no formal civic roles or notable public presence among them. One adjacent industrial landowner is a major company (handled separately), suggesting the only high-influence neighbor lies outside the individual resident profiles. All five neighboring landowners have no recorded positions for or against the project. Most exhibit low community influence (no official roles or public advocacy noted), with only one neighbor’s influence bolstered by a prominent local family background. Both identified neighbors have an **unknown** stance on the development due to no public statements found, and neither holds a notable influence in the community. In total, 0 neighbors show support, 0 oppose, and 2 are unknown; none are high-profile local figures. The adjacent landowners include a global chemical company, a public development agency, a freight railroad, and two private investment holders. None are grassroots community groups; their interests are largely economic or operational. Chemours (DuPont’s successor) and CSX are focused on managing legacy operations (environmental cleanup and rail service, respectively) rather than intervening in new projects. The Niagara County IDA is pro-development and likely an ally if the project promises jobs or investment. The LLC owners (2747 Buffalo Ave LLC and Elm Holdings Inc) appear to be speculators with no public stance, primarily interested in property value appreciation. Among the neighboring landowners, two are major energy entities (Niagara Mohawk Power Corp and the NY Power Authority) with significant influence and generally pro-development orientations. Another neighbor is a long-standing local nonprofit (Northpointe Council) focused on health services, which is unlikely to engage in land use disputes. The remaining owners include a private holding company (Elm Holdings Inc.) with undisclosed principals likely holding land as an investment, and a small event-center business (VT Event Centre LLC) with a low public profile; both appear unlikely to mount organized opposition. The adjacent landowners include a municipal government, a local church, and a private holding LLC – each with different interests and influence. The City of Niagara Falls (NY) is actively pursuing redevelopment and generally supportive of projects that boost the tax base ([www.developniagarafalls.com](https://www.developniagarafalls.com/#:~:text=The%20Development%20Opportunity)). New Hope Baptist Church is a small community congregation focused on worship, with no public record of engaging in development disputes ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). Sandstone Springs Holdings LLC appears to be a speculative landowner with anonymous backing, interested mainly in property value and without a visible community role ([cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com](https://cityofniagarafalls.prosgar.com/CustomContent/Disclaimer#:~:text=The%20information%20contained%20herein%2C%20including,or%20implied%2C%20of%20information%20provided)). This mix suggests the City wields high decision-making power, while the church and LLC have lower profiles and would likely influence a project only if their specific interests are directly affected.
